00041 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00042 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)
00043 
00044 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   16384
00045 
00046 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00047 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00048 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00050 struct xnthread;
00051 struct task_struct;
00052 
00053 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00054 
00055     /* Kernel mode side */
00056 
00057 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00058     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00059        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00060     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00061     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00062     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00063     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00064        - NULL for RT K threads,
00065        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00066        - current for RT US threads.
00067     */
00068 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00069 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00070 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00071 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00072 
00073     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00074     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00075     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00076     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00077 
00078     /* User mode side */
00079     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00080     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00081 
00082     /* Init block */
00083     struct xnthread *self;
00084     int imask;
00085     const char *name;
00086     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00087     void *cookie;
00088 
00089 } xnarchtcb_t;
00090 
00091 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00092 
00093     unsigned exception;
00094     struct pt_regs *regs;
00095 
00096 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00097 
00098 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00099 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->regs->dar)
00100 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00101 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00102 /* FIXME: FPU faults ignored by the nanokernel on PPC. */
00103 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  (0)
00104 
00105 /* The following predicates are only usable over a regular Linux stack
00106  *    context. */
00107 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE
00108 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_ACCESS_TRAP)
00109 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00110                                 ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_IABR_TRAP || \
00111                                 (fi)->exception == ADEOS_SSTEP_TRAP || \
00112                                 (fi)->exception == ADEOS_PERFMON_TRAP))
00113 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE */
00114 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->exception == IPIPE_TRAP_ACCESS)
00115 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00116                                 ((fi)->exception == IPIPE_TRAP_IABR || \
00117                                 (fi)->exception == IPIPE_TRAP_SSTEP || \
00118                                 (fi)->exception == IPIPE_TRAP_PERFMON))
00119 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE */
00120 
00121 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi))

00127 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00128 
00129 {
00130 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00131     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00132         return vmalloc(bytes);
00133 #endif
00134 
00135     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00136 }
00137 
00138 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00139 
00140 {
00141 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00142     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00143         vfree(chunk);
00144     else
00145 #endif
00146         kfree(chunk);
00147 }

00149 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00150 
00151 {
00152     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00153 }

00161 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00162                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))

00164     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00167 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00168 
00169 {
00170     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00171 
00172     rthal_load_cpuid();
00173 
00174     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00175        and always inside a critical section. */
00176     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00177     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00178     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00179 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00180     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00181     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00182     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00183                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00184                     : NULL);
00185 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00186 }
00187 
00188 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00189     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00190 }
00191 
00192 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00193                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00194 {
00195     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00196     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00197 
00198     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00199 
00200     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00201         {
00202         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00203 
00204         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00205 
00206 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00207         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00208            they don't work properly in our context. */
00209         if (cur_cpu_spec->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00210             asm volatile (
00211                 "dssall;\n"
00212                 : : );
00213         }
00214 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00215 
00216         if (!cpu_isset(smp_processor_id(), mm->cpu_vm_mask)) {
00217                 cpu_set(smp_processor_id(), mm->cpu_vm_mask);
00218         }
00219         
00220         if (cur_cpu_spec->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_SLB) {
00221                 switch_slb(next, mm);
00222         }
00223         else {
00224                 switch_stab(next, mm);
00225         }
00226         
00227         flush_tlb_pending();
00228         
00229         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00230 
00231         barrier();
00232         }
00233     else
00234         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00235         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00236 }
00237 
00238 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00239                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00240 {
00241     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00242 }
00243 
00244 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00245 
00246 {
00247     /* Empty */
00248 }
00249 
00250 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00251                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00252                                          const char *name)
00253 {
00254     tcb->user_task = current;
00255     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00256     tcb->ksp = 0;
00257     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00258 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00259     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00260     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00261 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00262     tcb->entry = NULL;
00263     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00264     tcb->self = thread;
00265     tcb->imask = 0;
00266     tcb->name = name;
00267 }
00268 
00269 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00270 
00271 {
00272     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00273     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00274     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00275     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00276 }
00277 
00278 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00279                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00280                                        void *cookie,
00281                                        int imask,
00282                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00283                                        char *name)
00284 {
00285     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00286 
00287     rthal_local_irq_flags_hw(flags);
00288 
00289     if (tcb->stackbase) {
00290         *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00291         
00292         ksp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 16) & ~0xf);
00293         *ksp = 0L; /* first stack frame back-chain */
00294         ksp = ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD; /* first stack frame (entry uses) */
00295         *ksp = (unsigned long)ksp+STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD; /* second back-chain */
00296         ksp = ksp - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE; /* domain context */
00297         tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00298         *((unsigned long *)tcb->ksp) = (unsigned long)ksp + 224; /*back-chain*/
00299         /* NOTE: these depend on rthal_switch_context ordering */
00300         ksp[18] = (unsigned long)get_paca(); /* r13 needs to hold paca */
00301         ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00302         ksp[20] = ((unsigned long *)&xnarch_thread_trampoline)[1]; /* r2 = TOC base */
00303         ksp[25] = ((unsigned long *)&xnarch_thread_trampoline)[0]; /* lr = entry addr. */
00304         ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00305     }
00306     else {
00307         printk("xnarch_init_thread: NULL stackbase!\n");
00308     }
00309 
00310     tcb->entry = entry;
00311     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00312     tcb->self = thread;
00313     tcb->imask = imask;
00314     tcb->name = name;
00315 }
00316 
00317 /* No lazy FPU init on PPC. */
00318 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) (1)
00319 
00320 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00321 
00322 {
00323 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00324     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00325         rthal_enable_fpu();
00326 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00327 }
00328 
00329 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00330 
00331 {
00332 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00333     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00334        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00335     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00336     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00337 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00338 }
00339 
00340 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00341 
00342 {
00343 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00344 
00345     if(tcb->fpup)
00346         {
00347         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00348 
00349         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00350             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00351         }   
00352 
00353 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00354 }
00355 
00356 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00357 
00358 {
00359 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00360 
00361     if(tcb->fpup)
00362         {
00363         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00364 
00365         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00366             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00367         }   
00368 
00369     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when Xenomai preempted Linux,
00370        whereas we could be much lazier. */
00371     if(tcb->user_task)
00372         rthal_disable_fpu();
00373 
00374 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00375 }
00376 
00377 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00378 
00379 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00380 
00381 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00382 
00383     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00384     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00385     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00386 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00387     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00388     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00389 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00390     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00391 }
00392 
00393 #define xnarch_alloc_stack(tcb,stacksize) \
00394 ({ \
00395     int __err; \
00396     (tcb)->stacksize = stacksize; \
00397     if (stacksize == 0) { \
00398         (tcb)->stackbase = NULL; \
00399         __err = 0; \
00400     } else { \
00401         (tcb)->stackbase = xnmalloc(stacksize); \
00402         __err = (tcb)->stackbase ? 0 : -ENOMEM; \
00403     } \
00404     __err; \
00405 })
00406 
00407 #define xnarch_free_stack(tcb) \
00408 do { \
00409       if ((tcb)->stackbase) \
00410           xnfree((tcb)->stackbase); \
00411 } while(0)
00412 
00413 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00414 
00415 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00416 
00417 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00418                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00419                                            const char *name)
00420 {
00421     struct task_struct *task = current;
00422 
00423     tcb->user_task = task;
00424     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00425     tcb->ksp = 0;
00426     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00427 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU
00428     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00429     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00430 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_FPU */
00431     tcb->entry = NULL;
00432     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00433     tcb->self = thread;
00434     tcb->imask = 0;
00435     tcb->name = name;
00436 }
00437 
00438 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00439 
00440 {
00441     unsigned irq;
00442 
00443     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00444         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00445                              irq,
00446                              handler,
00447                              NULL,
00448                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00449 
00450     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00451        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00452        individually. */
00453 
00454     rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00455                          RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ,
00456                          handler,
00457                          NULL,
00458                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00459 }
00460 
00461 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00462 
00463 {
00464     unsigned irq;
00465 
00466     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00467         {
00468         switch (irq)
00469             {
00470 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00471             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00472 
00473                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00474                 continue;
00475 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00476 
00477             default:
00478 
00479                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00480             }
00481         }
00482 
00483     rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00484 }
00485 
00486 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00487 
00488 {
00489     unsigned irq;
00490 
00491     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00492         {
00493         switch (irq)
00494             {
00495 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00496             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00497 
00498                 continue;
00499 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00500 
00501             default:
00502 
00503                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00504             }
00505         }
00506 
00507     rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ);
00508 }
00509 
00510 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00511 
00512 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00513 
00514 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00515     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00516        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00517        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00518        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00519        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00520        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00521     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00522 }
00523 
00524 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00525     rthal_timer_release();
00526 }
00527 
00528 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00529 
00530 {
00531 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00532     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00533 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00534     return 0;
00535 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00536 }
00537 
00538 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00540 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00541 
00542 #include <linux/init.h>
00543 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00544 
00545 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00546 
00547 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00548 
00549 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00550 
00551 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00552 
00553 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00554 
00555 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00556 
00557 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00558 {
00559     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00560     fltinfo.exception = event;
00561     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00562     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00563 }
00564 
00565 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00566 
00567 {
00568 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00569     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00570 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00571     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00572        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00573     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00574 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00575 }
00576 
00577 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00578 
00579 {
00580     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00581 
00582     if (!nktimerlat)
00583         return -ENODEV;
00584 
00585     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00586 
00587     return 0;
00588 }
00589 
00590 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00591 
00592 {
00593     int err;
00594 
00595 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00596     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00597        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00598     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00599 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00600 
00601     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00602 
00603     if (err)
00604         return err;
00605 
00606     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00607 
00608     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00609         return -ENOSYS;
00610 
00611     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00612                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00613                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00614                          NULL,
00615                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00616 
00617     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00618 
00619 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00620     err = xnshadow_mount();
00621 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00622 
00623     if (err)
00624         {
00625         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00626         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00627         }
00628 
00629     return err;
00630 }
00631 
00632 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00633 
00634 {
00635 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00636     xnshadow_cleanup();
00637 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00638     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00639     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00640 }
00641 
00642 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00643 
00644 #ifdef __cplusplus
00645 }
00646 #endif
